intro: Galedupa pinnata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed galedupa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves, which are often narrow and arranged alternately along the stems. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in inflorescences. Galedupa pinnata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
